user.title: Appliance Patterns
user.description:
Select the power sensors (in watts) feeding this appliance and fine‑tune the detection thresholds. Recommendations:
- set the ON threshold slightly above the standby draw
- set the OFF threshold near zero but still above noise
- OFF delay must be long enough to ignore short pauses
- the detection window should be longer than the longest program
Quick recognition tips:
- reduce sampling interval to 2–3 s for express programs
- keep the window around 900–1 200 s if you mainly track 30 min cycles
- run each program twice so the model learns reliable templates

data.name: Appliance name (label for the entities)
data.on_power: Start threshold in watts (ex: 15 W for dishwasher)
data.off_power: Stop threshold in watts (ex: 3‑5 W idle)
data.off_delay: Stop delay in seconds (buffer before closing a run)
data.sample_interval: Sampling interval in seconds (5 s gives good balance)
data.window_duration: Detection window in seconds (>= longest cycle, e.g. 1800 s)
data.min_run_duration: Minimum duration in seconds to store a run (filters spikes)

options.title: Detection parameters
options.description:
Adjust thresholds and timings while the integration is running. Tips:
- lower ON threshold if cycles are missed
- raise OFF threshold/delay if runs split too early
- increase window duration for very long programs
- shorten window + sampling interval when you only need fast 30 min runs
Need help? Press the Auto-calibration button or call the auto_tune service after a full cycle.
